page.title: 17THE CIRCUS COMES TO TOWN
page.content: WE ONLY HAVE A CIRCUS ONCE A YEAR IN CAMBRIDGE,IT TAKES PLACE ON MIDSUMMER COMMON IN A BIG TENT.THE CIRCUS OWNER IS GERRY COTTON.THE CIRCUS IS NOT ALLOWED TO USE ANY ANIMALS IN CAMBRIDGE BECAUSE PEOPLE THINK THAT IT IS CRUEL TO KEEP THEM LOCKED UP. AT THE CIRCUS YOU CAN BUY HOT FOOD, CANDY FLOSS AND ICE CREAM AND YOU CAN WATCH CLOWNS,FIRE EATERS, JUGGLERS, TIGHT-ROPE WALKERS, ACROBATS AND SWORD-SWALLOWERS. I LIKE THE CLOWNS,THEY DRIVE INTO THE RING IN A FUNNY CAR AND THE DOORS DROP OFF,THEN THEY THROW CUSTARD PIES AT EACH OTHER AND POUR WATER DOWN EACH OTHERS TROUSERS. GERRY COTTLE'S CIRCUS TRAVELS ALL OVER BRITAIN;IT COSTS Â£2-50 FOR ADULTS AND Â£1-50 FOR CHILDREN.
